summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of Janusz Banasiak, a former household employee for Jeffrey Epstein, conducted on October 19, 2021. Banasiak details his hiring process, job duties, the household manual, message logs, and his experience during the 2005 search warrant execution at Epstein's Florida property. He worked for Epstein from 2005 to 2017.

persons.name: Janusz Banasiak
persons.role: Former Household Employee for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Interviewed by the FBI about his employment with Jeffrey Epstein from 2005 to 2017. He was responsible for household maintenance, driving, and managing petty cash.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation. Banasiak describes his role as Epstein's employee, his travel habits, and the aftermath of his arrest and guilty plea.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Interviewed Banasiak for the job and was a primary source of instructions on Epstein's preferences and household protocols.

persons.name: Dr. Garecki
persons.context: Name appears in a message log entry dated 2/18/05 that Banasiak recognized as his own handwriting.

connections.description: Banasiak was employed by Epstein as a household manager and driver from 2005 to 2017.
Maxwell interviewed and hired Banasiak and was his primary point of contact for instructions related to Epstein's household.
Maxwell acted on Epstein's behalf in hiring staff and managing household affairs, as described by Banasiak.

events.title: Banasiak Hired by Epstein
events.description: Janusz Banasiak is hired through an agency after interviews with Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein. He moves to Florida to work on Epstein's property.

events.title: Search Warrant Executed at Florida Property
events.description: Police arrive with a search warrant at Epstein's Florida property while Banasiak is present. He is shown the warrant and witnesses the search.

events.title: Banasiak's Employment Period
events.description: Banasiak works for Epstein from 2005 until 2017, living in a small house on the property.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea and Jail Time
events.description: Banasiak learns from news reports that Epstein pleaded guilty to solicitation of underage prostitution and went to jail. He drove Epstein to court for his appearance.

locations: Lexington Avenue and Park Avenue (Maxwell's townhouse)
keyFacts: Janusz Banasiak worked as a household employee for Jeffrey Epstein from 2005 to 2017, living on the Florida property.
Banasiak was interviewed and hired by Ghislaine Maxwell, who gave him detailed instructions on Epstein's preferences via a household manual.
Banasiak was present during the execution of a search warrant at Epstein's Florida property in 2005, which was his first knowledge of an investigation.
Banasiak identified his own handwriting in message logs from 2004-2005, confirming his role in managing communications for the household.
After Epstein's arrest and guilty plea, employee salaries were cut by 10% and not restored after Epstein's release.
